intro: Asteromoea mongolica, commonly known as the Mongolian asteromoea, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of Mongolia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Asteromoea mongolica is often found in sandy soils and is an important part of the local flora in its native habitat.
